Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Error: "java.exe" exited with code 1 in Release mode" (#1369) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open up any Xamarin.Android project
2. Change Solution Configuration to Release mode
3. Try to build the solution

### Expected Behavior
Successful build.

### Actual Behavior
I got this error
> "java.exe" exited with code 1.

### Version Information
I'm using VS 2017, v 15.6

> Xamarin   4.9.0.749
Xamarin Designer   4.10.58
Xamarin.Android SDK   8.2.0.15

I tired following:
1. Updating Proguard to latest version
2. Updating JDK (jdk1.8.0_162), but downgraded to 161 again
3. Set 1G as Java max heap size
4. And all other solutions that you can find here: https://forums.xamarin.com/discussion/9305/java-exe-exited-with-code-1-xamarin-android-common-targets

I'm using Support library v4 and v7, Picaso, CallygraphyXamarin and JSON.net

In Debug mode I can build and archive the solution without any problem.

__Update__:
If I disable Proguard , I can get successful build/archive.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "ValidateJavaVersion should check both java and javac version" (#1642) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The JDK and JRE are distinct releases from Oracle, and it is possible for the versions not to match within the same environment.

We warn the user if the JRE (`java` binary) is too new, but don't detect mismatches, and don't gracefully deal with the JDK (`javac` binary) being too new.

Repro:
1. `sudo apt install openjdk-9-jdk openjdk-8-jre`
2. `sudo update-alternatives --config java` -> set to Java 8
3. `sudo update-alternatives --config javac` -> set to Java 9


Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[build] fixes for MSBuild project timing" (#1640) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://jenkins.mono-project.com/view/Xamarin.Android/job/xamarin-android/plot/Build%20times/

The first issue with the new plots is I am storing `TimeSpan` data in
the CSV file. The Jenkins plugin for plots, doesn't seem to be able to
render this. I have converted the data to milliseconds instead.

The second issue is all of the `Install` targets for
`HelloWorld.csproj` are getting `[INSTALL_FAILED_NO_MATCHING_ABIS]`.
The fix for this is to pass `/p:AndroidSupportedAbis=x86` for each
build.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "System.InvalidCastException: Unable to convert instance of type 'Android.Widget.LinearLayout' to type 'Android.Support.V7.Widget.Toolbar'." (#1641) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Build and run repro on Pixel XL 8.1 stock - only happens when proguard is enabled.

I think it'll happen on any device 8.0 + (unproven)



REPRO
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qo3TtgJb-wnXyHKWuqLJLJGw5fPvEgfD/view?usp=sharing

### Expected Behavior
Run fine

### Actual Behavior
Throws exception in MainActivity.onCreate

### Version Information
***All in repro*** - sorry, out of time, can't type all this info

Hope it fails for you guys too.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[build] fixes for MSBuild project timing" (#1640) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://jenkins.mono-project.com/view/Xamarin.Android/job/xamarin-android/plot/Build%20times/

The first issue with the new plots is I am storing `TimeSpan` data in

The fix for this is to pass `/p:AndroidSupportedAbis=x86` for each
build.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[mmp] Cache is never cleared" (#4034) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
While looking at #4033, I couldn't see where mmp cleared the cache (if -f was passed or some of the arguments changed).

mtouch does this in mtouch-specific code: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/blob/564ca2dac602a0f3c90a757656abf327822c76e1/tools/mtouch/Application.cs#L771-L804

This means the cache is never invalidated in mmp.

OTOH I think this sounds worse than it is, because I couldn't find anywhere in mmp where we actually check if files in the cache are up-to-date before doing things (so effectively mmp is always in -f mode). This is obviously also an issue that should be fixed, but can be fixed separately.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The contents of response files aren't taken into account when determining whether the cache is still valid or not" (#4033) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Repro:

0. Enable verbose build log.
1. Create a new project.
2. Add something to the additional mtouch arguments (for instance `-gcc_flags -v`).
3. Build
4. Change the additional mtouch arguments (for instance to `-gcc_flags -v -v`).
5. Build again. The build log should state that the cache was cleared:

> A full rebuild has been forced because the cache for ... is not valid.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[mtouch] Take into account the contents of response files when determining whether the cache is valid or not." (#4032) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Opened issue "SCNHitTestOptions SearchMode bound incorrectly" (#4031) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
`SCNHitTestOptions.SearchMode` has two problems:

1. It isn't settable
2. It's incorrectly named **Option**SearchMode (should just be `SearchMode`)

(also the key is incorrectly named **Option**SearchModeKey (should just be `SearchModeKey`))

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create `SCNHitTestOptions`
2. Try to set the `SearchMode`

### Expected Behavior

I should be able to set `SearchMode` to one of the enum values.

### Actual Behavior

There is no settable property.

Work around with

```csharp
NSDictionary.FromObjectsAndKeys (new NSObject[] { NSNumber.FromInt64 ((long)SCNHitTestSearchMode.All), NSNumber.FromBoolean (true) },
                                                 new NSObject[] { SCNHitTest.OptionSearchModeKey, SCNHitTest.BackFaceCullingKey });
```

### Environment


Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "SCNPhysicsShape.Create transforms param is bound incorrectly" (#4030) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
SCNPhysicsShape.Create `transform` params should be an array of `SCNMatrix4` not `SCNVector3`.

https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/blob/master/src/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsShape.cs#L20

### Steps to Reproduce

```
var shape1 = SCNPhysicsShape.Create (Box (diameter, length, diameter));
var options = new SCNPhysicsShapeOptions ();
var shapes = new[] { shape1 };
var transforms = new SCNVector3[] { SCNVector3.Zero };
var shape = SCNPhysicsShape.Create (shapes, transforms);
```

1. Run the above code
2. Use the physics `shape` in a scene
3. Note that it doesn't work

### Expected Behavior

I should be able to full matrix transforms, not just vectors.

### Actual Behavior

Bad physics

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Remove btouch.csproj and bmac.csproj, they're superceded by generator.csproj." (#4029) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Merged pull request "[MT.D] Bump maccore and macios-binaries to get MT.D fixes" (#4027) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
macios-binaries
---------------

This brings prebuilt MT.D binaries using the following hash

 https://github.com/migueldeicaza/MonoTouch.Dialog/commit/188ba0ac4511b7f93a1e94a1f67cc581e682907c

Fixes the following breaking change:

```
MonoTouch.Dialog-1.dll

Namespace MonoTouch.Dialog

Type Changed: MonoTouch.Dialog.DialogViewController.Source

Removed field:

	protected DialogViewController Container;
```

maccore
-------

Uses the new MT.D binary path for docs

Fixes

```
/Applications/Xcode93.app/Contents/Developer/usr/bin/make -C ../../maccore update-docs
make[3]: *** No rule to make target `../xamarin-macios/src/build/ios/reference/MonoTouch.Dialog-1.dll', needed by `update-ios-docs'.  Stop.
```
